section.label: 01_welcome
section.title: Welcome to openSUSE
section.para: Whether you use your computer to communicate with friends, relatives, or colleagues, manage and enjoy your pictures and music, browse the Internet for the latest news or information, write a report or budget, or host a personal Web site or home network, you will find everything you need in openSUSE &suse-version;

section.label: 02_opensuse
section.title: openSUSE.org
section.para: This distribution is created by the openSUSE.org project. The openSUSE project, sponsored by Novell, is a collaborative community effort to deliver the world's most usable open source computing platform, the openSUSE distribution. Hosted at opensuse.org, many individuals are involved in packaging software, testing programs, writing documentation, and also localizing components.
openSUSE is available in many languages. Localization for openSUSE specific software is done by community-driven language teams. Find the localization portal at http://i18n.opensuse.org/ .
Visit www.opensuse.org to learn how you can join the openSUSE community.

section.label: 03_connect
section.title: Connect and Communicate
section.para: openSUSE &suse-version; provides a complete set of tools for Web browsing and e-mail management and even includes the newest Internet-based phone technology.

The Firefox Web browser is one of the best Web browser in the market. It boasts a complete set of browser features, including Java, Adobe Reader, RealPlayer, and Macromedia Flash plug-ins, plus lightning-fast performance.

Novell Evolution and Kontact are complete e-mail and contact managers that you can use to manage all your mail accounts. openSUSE also includes state-of-the-art Internet-based (VoIP) solutions that let you call people connected to the Internet all over the world.

section.label: 04_create
section.title: Create, View, and Listen
section.para: Download tunes from the Internet. Rip CDs to create your own customized music library. Listen to your playlist online. Burn a CD or DVD. Even copy your files to an iPod or similar device to take your music anywhere. Manage and edit digital pictures with powerful graphics editors. It is easy with openSUSE.

section.label: 05_office
section.title: Documents, Spreadsheets, and More
section.para: openSUSE &suse-version; comes complete with the latest version of the leading Linux productivity suite, OpenOffice.org. Openoffice.org includes a word processor, spreadsheet application, HTML editor, presentation designer, and database. It also reads and writes files you can use with popular non-Linux productivity software. It is the perfect choice for reports, papers, home budgets, and simple graphics.

section.label: 06_graphics
section.title: Graphics, Graphics, Graphics
section.para: With the tools in openSUSE, you can create or edit practically any kind of graphics. For advanced image manipulation and graphics creation, use powerful tools like the GIMP, a complete image retouching, composition, and authoring tool.
For vector graphics, try Inkscape, a versatile graphics solution complete with support for transparent layers, bitmap tracing, text paths, and much more.

section.label: 08_mobility
section.title: Computing On-the-Go
section.para: openSUSE includes the most advanced mobility features. Switch between wireless and wired networks using NetworkManager. Connect with mobile devices like mobile phones and PDAs via Bluetooth. Use infrared ports to synchronize your data. Newest innovations in power management increase your mobility.

section.label: 09_security
section.title: Keep Your System Secure and Up-to-Date
section.para: SUSE Firewall helps secure your system and data from Internet intruders. It is activated by default and easy to configure. openSUSE also includes AppArmor, the most effective and easy-to-use Linux application security system available today. It proactively protects the operating system and applications from external or internal threats.

openSUSE also includes a special security patch update system. To ensure that the latest security patches are installed on your system, choose to perform an online update at the end of this installation procedure. In the future, you will be informed of the availability of important security updates, so you can install them at your convenience.

section.label: 10_devel
section.title: Virtualization Technology and Application Development Tools
section.para: openSUSE includes the highest performing virtualization software, the XEN hypervisor. In addition, openSUSE provides tools for network file sharing, printing (Samba) and Web hosting (Apache). For application development, openSUSE comes with a complete set of runtime environments plus extensive application development tools, including KDevelop, Eclipse, and Mono. Almost everything can be build with openSUSE.
Join openSUSE.org to collaborate. Create and share new packages for multiple Linux distribution using the unique and powerful openSUSE Build Service.

section.label: 11_docs
section.title: Learn More
section.para:
openSUSE provides extensive documentation for SUSE-specific as well as general Linux-related questions. The SUSE Help Center is accessible via the main menu. Manuals are also available in PDF-format and can be downloaded and printed
(http://en.opensuse.org/Documentation).

Even more information is available in the openSUSE wiki at
http://en.opensuse.org/. In Documentation, find links to all sorts of useful information created and maintained by other openSUSE users. Also find links to the documentation available on the Novell Web site. For help with specific problems with openSUSE, check out the Support Database.

section.label: 12_novell
section.title: Novell and Linux
section.para: Novell is committed to your success with Linux. Besides openSUSE, Novell delivers an exciting suite of products designed to meet the needs of businesses large and small.

The enterprise Linux products from Novell include SUSE Linux Enterprise Server, SUSE Linux Enterprise Desktop, and Novell Open Enterprise Server. Our enterprise products are delivered with a seven year maintenance guarantee, optional support programs, and a unique Linux indemnification program.
